title: What does the measurement 'a gill of water' mean? Fish have gills, but does it mean something different? - Quora

response.answer_text: What does the measurement "a gill of water" mean? Fish have gills, but does it mean something different? The gill (it’s pronounced more like jill than gill, by the way) is a unit of liquid volume. It has several values, but it’s about half a cup. Gill (unit) - Wikipedia

[What does the measurement "a gill of water" mean? Fish have gills, but does it mean something different?] It’s a measurement of liquid volume: the amount that would fill a fish’s gill. The measurement of a gill of water in millilitres depends on the size of the fish.
